classData.comment:
/**
 * Config object for the neo.mjs framework which will get passed to all workers
 * You can change the configs, e.g. inside the index.html of your app
 * @memberOf module:Neo
 * @name config
 * @type Object
 */
classData.description: Config object for the neo.mjs framework which will get passed to all workers You can change the configs, e.g. inside the index.html of your app
classData.name: config

classData.comment:
/**
     * true will apply 'neo-body' to the document.body classList
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.applyBodyCls
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: true will apply 'neo-body' to the document.body classList
classData.name: config.applyBodyCls

classData.comment:
/**
     * true will apply 'position: fixed' to the html tag itself
     * See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/issues/6429
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.applyFixedPositionToHtmlTag
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: true will apply 'position: fixed' to the html tag itself See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/issues/6429
classData.name: config.applyFixedPositionToHtmlTag

classData.comment:
/**
     * Path to your app.mjs file. You can create multiple apps there if needed.
     * @default null
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.appPath
     * @type String|null
     */
classData.description: Path to your app.mjs file. You can create multiple apps there if needed.
classData.name: config.appPath

classData.comment:
/**
     * Path to the neo.mjs directory
     * @default './'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.basePath
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: Path to the neo.mjs directory
classData.name: config.basePath

classData.comment:
/**
     * Pass a token in case you are using the CesiumJS main thread addon
     * See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/blob/dev/src/main/addon/CesiumJS.mjs
     * @default undefined
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.cesiumJsToken
     * @type String|null
     */
classData.description: Pass a token in case you are using the CesiumJS main thread addon See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/blob/dev/src/main/addon/CesiumJS.mjs
classData.name: config.cesiumJsToken

classData.comment:
/**
     * Set this config to false to disable the component logging using Ctrl-Right-Click
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.enableComponentLogger
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Set this config to false to disable the component logging using Ctrl-Right-Click
classData.name: config.enableComponentLogger

classData.comment:
/**
     * Set this config to true to enable util.Logger (Neo.log()) based logs in production
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.enableLogsInProduction
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Set this config to true to enable util.Logger (Neo.log()) based logs in production
classData.name: config.enableLogsInProduction

classData.comment:
/**
     * The current environment. Valid values: 'development', 'dist/development', 'dist/production'
     * This config will get auto-generated
     * @default 'dist/production'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.environment
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: The current environment. Valid values: 'development', 'dist/development', 'dist/production' This config will get auto-generated
classData.name: config.environment

classData.comment:
/**
     * In case you are using the GoogleMaps main thread addon, you can pass the API key here.
     * @default undefined
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.googleMapsApiKey
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: In case you are using the GoogleMaps main thread addon, you can pass the API key here.
classData.name: config.googleMapsApiKey

classData.comment:
/**
     * In case you are using the GoogleAnalytics main thread addon or useGoogleAnalytics: true,
     * you can change the gtag id here. Required for the online examples (gh pages)
     * @default undefined
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.gtagId
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: In case you are using the GoogleAnalytics main thread addon or useGoogleAnalytics: true, you can change the gtag id here. Required for the online examples (gh pages)
classData.name: config.gtagId

classData.comment:
/**
     * Flag for running on https://neomjs.github.io/pages/
     * => to use local images paths instead of raw.githubusercontent.com
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.isGitHubPages
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Flag for running on https://neomjs.github.io/pages/ => to use local images paths instead of raw.githubusercontent.com
classData.name: config.isGitHubPages

classData.comment:
/**
     * Flag for running Neo.mjs inside the middleware Node.js process.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.isMiddleware
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Flag for running Neo.mjs inside the middleware Node.js process.
classData.name: config.isMiddleware

classData.comment:
/**
     * delay in ms for the worker.Manager:loadApplication() call
     * @default 20
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.loadApplicationDelay
     * @type Number
     */
classData.description: delay in ms for the worker.Manager:loadApplication() call
classData.name: config.loadApplicationDelay

classData.comment:
/**
     * Used by Intl.DateTimeFormat, for details take a look at:
     * https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/DateTimeFormat
     * @default 'default'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.locale
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: Used by Intl.DateTimeFormat, for details take a look at: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/DateTimeFormat
classData.name: config.locale

classData.comment:
/**
     * true will log the delta updates inside the main thread(s) as well as the requestAnimation frames
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.logDeltaUpdates
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: true will log the delta updates inside the main thread(s) as well as the requestAnimation frames
classData.name: config.logDeltaUpdates

classData.comment:
/**
     * true will log console warnings, in case a component tries to update() while a parent update is running.
     * A parent update results in a short delay, so you might want to resolve these collisions.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.logVdomUpdateCollisions
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: true will log console warnings, in case a component tries to update() while a parent update is running. A parent update results in a short delay, so you might want to resolve these collisions.
classData.name: config.logVdomUpdateCollisions

classData.comment:
/**
     * Add addons for the main thread
     * ./src/main/addon/ contains all framework related options.
     * You can also create your own addons within your workspace scope. Make sure to put them inside 'src/main/addon/'
     * and prefix them with 'WS/' inside your neo-config.json file.
     * Example: ['DragDrop', 'Stylesheet', 'WS/MyAddon']
     * @default ['DragDrop', 'Navigator', 'Stylesheet']
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.mainThreadAddons
     * @type String[]
     */
classData.description: Add addons for the main thread ./src/main/addon/ contains all framework related options. You can also create your own addons within your workspace scope. Make sure to put them inside 'src/main/addon/' and prefix them with 'WS/' inside your neo-config.json file. Example: ['DragDrop', 'Stylesheet', 'WS/MyAddon']
classData.name: config.mainThreadAddons

classData.comment:
/**
     * The URL for the Neural Link WebSocket connection.
     * @default 'ws://127.0.0.1:8081'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.neuralLinkUrl
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: The URL for the Neural Link WebSocket connection.
classData.name: config.neuralLinkUrl

classData.comment:
/**
     * Pass the URL of a JSON-file, which contains the services and methods from your backend,
     * which you want to expose to the client.
     * See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/projects/32
     * @default null
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.remotesApiUrl
     * @type String|null
     */
classData.description: Pass the URL of a JSON-file, which contains the services and methods from your backend, which you want to expose to the client. See: https://github.com/neomjs/neo/projects/32
classData.name: config.remotesApiUrl

classData.comment:
/**
     * You can visually show the amount of delta updates per second using this config.
     * It expects a dom node with the id "neo-delta-updates" as the rendering target.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.renderCountDeltas
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: You can visually show the amount of delta updates per second using this config. It expects a dom node with the id "neo-delta-updates" as the rendering target.
classData.name: config.renderCountDeltas

classData.comment:
/**
     * Add themes you want to use here. The first theme will get applied.
     * @default ['neo-theme-light','neo-theme-dark','neo-theme-neo-light']
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.themes
     * @type String[]
     */
classData.description: Add themes you want to use here. The first theme will get applied.
classData.name: config.themes

classData.comment:
/**
     * Flag for standalone Siesta module tests => prevent registerRemote worker messages
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.unitTestMode
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Flag for standalone Siesta module tests => prevent registerRemote worker messages
classData.name: config.unitTestMode

classData.comment:
/**
     * When unitTestMode is true, this flag can be enabled to allow VDOM-related
     * operations like initVnode() and update() to proceed. This is useful for integration-style
     * tests that need to verify component lifecycle and DOM output.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.allowVdomUpdatesInTests
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: When unitTestMode is true, this flag can be enabled to allow VDOM-related operations like initVnode() and update() to proceed. This is useful for integration-style tests that need to verify component lifecycle and DOM output.
classData.name: config.allowVdomUpdatesInTests

classData.comment:
/**
     * Set this to true to establish a WebSocket connection to the Neural Link MCP Server.
     * This enables bidirectional communication between the App Worker and external AI Agents.
     *
     * You can also use a string or array of strings to specify the target environment(s).
     * Example: 'development' or ['development', 'dist/production']
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useAiClient
     * @type Boolean|String|String[]
     */
classData.description:
Set this to true to establish a WebSocket connection to the Neural Link MCP Server. This enables bidirectional communication between the App Worker and external AI Agents.

You can also use a string or array of strings to specify the target environment(s). Example: 'development' or ['development', 'dist/production']
classData.name: config.useAiClient

classData.comment:
/**
     * Experimental flag if an offscreen canvas worker should get created.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useCanvasWorker
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Experimental flag if an offscreen canvas worker should get created.
classData.name: config.useCanvasWorker

classData.comment:
/**
     * `true` will enable the advanced, secure, and performant direct DOM API rendering strategy (recommended).
     * In this mode, `Neo.vdom.Helper` will create and send structured VNode object graphs to the Main Thread.
     * `Neo.main.DeltaUpdates` will then use `Neo.main.render.DomApiRenderer` to directly manipulate the DOM.
     * Crucially, `Neo.main.render.DomApiRenderer` builds new **DOM subtrees** (from the received VNode object graphs)
     * as detached DocumentFragments or elements, entirely outside the live DOM tree.
     * These fully constructed fragments are then inserted into the live document in a **single, atomic operation**.
     * This approach inherently minimizes costly browser reflows/repaints, drastically reduces Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) risks,
     * and optimizes for surgical, atomic DOM updates for unparalleled performance.
     *
     * `false` will enable the legacy string-based rendering strategy.
     * In this mode, `Neo.vdom.Helper` will generate complete HTML strings (`outerHTML`) for VNode subtrees.
     * `Neo.main.DeltaUpdates` will then use `Neo.main.render.StringBasedRenderer` to insert these
     * strings into the DOM using methods like `parentNode.insertAdjacentHTML()`.
     * While performant for large insertions, this mode is generally less secure due to potential XSS vectors
     * and relies on browser HTML parsing, which can be less efficient for granular updates.
     *
     * This configuration affects both the initial painting of your applications and the creation
     * of new component trees at runtime.
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useDomApiRenderer
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description:
true will enable the advanced, secure, and performant direct DOM API rendering strategy (recommended). In this mode, Neo.vdom.Helper will create and send structured VNode object graphs to the Main Thread. Neo.main.DeltaUpdates will then use Neo.main.render.DomApiRenderer to directly manipulate the DOM. Crucially, Neo.main.render.DomApiRenderer builds new DOM subtrees (from the received VNode object graphs) as detached DocumentFragments or elements, entirely outside the live DOM tree. These fully constructed fragments are then inserted into the live document in a single, atomic operation. This approach inherently minimizes costly browser reflows/repaints, drastically reduces Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) risks, and optimizes for surgical, atomic DOM updates for unparalleled performance.

false will enable the legacy string-based rendering strategy. In this mode, Neo.vdom.Helper will generate complete HTML strings (outerHTML) for VNode subtrees. Neo.main.DeltaUpdates will then use Neo.main.render.StringBasedRenderer to insert these strings into the DOM using methods like parentNode.insertAdjacentHTML(). While performant for large insertions, this mode is generally less secure due to potential XSS vectors and relies on browser HTML parsing, which can be less efficient for granular updates.

This configuration affects both the initial painting of your applications and the creation of new component trees at runtime.
classData.name: config.useDomApiRenderer

classData.comment:
/**
     * Flag if vdom ids should get mapped into DOM element ids.
     * false will convert them into a "data-neo-id" attribute.
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useDomIds
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Flag if vdom ids should get mapped into DOM element ids. false will convert them into a "data-neo-id" attribute.
classData.name: config.useDomIds

classData.comment:
/**
     * True will automatically include the stylesheet
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useFontAwesome
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: True will automatically include the stylesheet
classData.name: config.useFontAwesome

classData.comment:
/**
     * Intended for the online examples where we need an easy way to add GA to every generated app
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useGoogleAnalytics
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Intended for the online examples where we need an easy way to add GA to every generated app
classData.name: config.useGoogleAnalytics

classData.comment:
/**
     * True will add the ServiceWorker main thread addon to support caching of assets (PWA)
     * See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API
     *
     * You can also use a string to specify the target environment => 'dist/production'.
     * Using 'dist/production' will also use the service worker for 'dist/esm'
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useServiceWorker
     * @type Boolean|String
     */
classData.description:
True will add the ServiceWorker main thread addon to support caching of assets (PWA) See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API

You can also use a string to specify the target environment => 'dist/production'. Using 'dist/production' will also use the service worker for 'dist/esm'
classData.name: config.useServiceWorker

classData.comment:
/**
     * Creates App, Data & VDom as SharedWorkers.
     * Set this one to true in case you want to connect multiple main threads.
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useSharedWorkers
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: Creates App, Data & VDom as SharedWorkers. Set this one to true in case you want to connect multiple main threads.
classData.name: config.useSharedWorkers

classData.comment:
/**
     * True will generate a new task worker, which can get filled with own expensive remote methods
     * @default false
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useTaskWorker
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: True will generate a new task worker, which can get filled with own expensive remote methods
classData.name: config.useTaskWorker

classData.comment:
/**
     * False will create the vdom.Helper within the App worker (experimental!)
     * @default true
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.useVdomWorker
     * @type Boolean
     */
classData.description: False will create the vdom.Helper within the App worker (experimental!)
classData.name: config.useVdomWorker

classData.comment:
/**
     * buildScripts/injectPackageVersion.mjs will update this value
     * @default '11.18.0'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.version
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: buildScripts/injectPackageVersion.mjs will update this value
classData.name: config.version

classData.comment:
/**
     * Path to the top level neo.mjs resources folder
     * @default Neo.config.basePath + 'resources/'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.resourcesPath
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: Path to the top level neo.mjs resources folder
classData.name: config.resourcesPath

classData.comment:
/**
     * The default base URL for web worker entry points (App, Data, Vdom)
     * @default Neo.config.basePath + 'src/worker/'
     * @memberOf! module:Neo
     * @name config.workerBasePath
     * @type String
     */
classData.description: The default base URL for web worker entry points (App, Data, Vdom)
classData.name: config.workerBasePath
